column119: The Axens Group (www.axens.net) offers a complete range of solutions for the conversion of oil and biomass into cleaner fuels, the production and purification of major petrochemical intermediates, the chemical recycling of plastics, natural gas treatment and conversion options, water treatment and carbon capture. Their offer includes technologies, equipment, furnaces, modular units, catalysts, adsorbents and related services. Axens is ideally positioned to cover the entire value chain, from feasibility studies to start-up and monitoring of units throughout their lifecycle. This unique position guarantees optimum performance and a reduced environmental footprint. Axens' international offering is based on highly qualified human resources, modern production facilities and an extensive global network for industrial, technical support and sales services. Axens is an IFP Group company.

Not all 8 hours are created equal ... We have the BEST!

#TheBest8Hours
column119:
Since opening Seneca Niagara Casino in 2002, Seneca Gaming Corporation has grown into one of the largest private sector employers in Western New York, with 4,000 employees at its three locations. The company operates world-class facilities offering more than 6,000 slot machines, 140 table games, 1,000 hotel rooms, a championship golf course and other related amenities.

Established by the Seneca Nation of Indians in August of 2002, Seneca Gaming Corporation is the umbrella company of three incredible gaming and resort destinations, and an award-winning golf course. With our wide array of services and amenities, there are literally hundreds of exciting opportunities to grow your career with us. From Table Games Dealers to Culinary Professionals, Advertising and Marketing experts to Hospitality and Spa, there’s a role for everyone!  And with guests from all over the world, no two days are ever alike! You’ll never be bored here – that’s why we like to think we have The Best 8 Hours around.

View a FULL LIST of current career opportunities: thebest8hours.com
column151:
Cynthia is an accomplished brand strategy and marketing executive with over 20 years of experience in hospitality, travel and leisure. She currently serves as the Chief Marketing Officer for Seneca Gaming Corporation where she oversees all marketing functions including brand strategy, advertising, sales, digital marketing, revenue management, entertainment, loyalty marketing, and customer development. 

Previously, she served as Vice President of Global Brand Management for Travel + Leisure Co., where she led brand marketing strategy supporting $2 billion in sales revenue and elevating brand awareness for 20 brands. Throughout her impressive career, Cynthia worked for leading global hospitality brands including Caesars Entertainment, Las Vegas Sands, and Wyndham Hotels & Resorts.

column119: HCLTech is a global technology company, home to more than 223,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. As the Vice President and Global Head of Marketing, I focus on creating long term value and driving growth through multi-channel marketing engagement with existing and prospective clients, partners, influencers and employees in key markets. 

I bring 18+ years of experience in B2B Marketing for technology and professional services companies. My value comes from providing a strategic and agile approach to solving business problems with a data-led decision making approach to inform the optimal marketing interventions. During my tenure at Genpact, I have helped reposition the company as a credible and disruptive force in digital transformation across various industries, services, and capabilities. I take an audience-first approach and translate complex business solutions into simple and compelling campaign stories that reach the target buyers through multi-media and multi-channel marketing.

I lead a team of amazing professionals across client, partner and talent marketing and drive a behaviour to think audience first Marketing approach. My core principles include staying proactive, sharp and laser focused on delivering programs that matter to business with a consultative and collaborative approach. 

An avid learner through experience and by acquiring new skills following the industry, motivates me to experiment new ways of taking programs to market.

column151:
Arjun A Sethi leads digital and business transformation strategies for HCLTech's high growth segments including government and global private equity.  

He leverages deep industry expertise to bring HCLTech's engineering-led technology portfolio, digital services and differentiated Gen AI solutions to these high growth segments. His international experience spans the Americas, APAC and the Middle East markets across government, private equity and financial services. 

Prior to joining HCLTech, Arjun spent 25 years at Kearney where he served in a variety of leadership roles including Vice Chair of Digital Transformation and, Regional Chairman for the Asia Pacific Region. Arjun set up Kearney's Digital practice Globally. In 2016 he was selected as one of the top 25 consultants by the Consulting magazine for “Excellence in Leadership,” and for the work he had done establishing and growing A.T. Kearney's Digital Transformation Practice. 

For his significant contribution towards the business community, Arjun is actively mentioned in the mainstream media including CNBC, Bloomberg on topics spanning innovation and the digital economy. Arjun is a regular contributor to BankTech and recognized in significant financial publications such as American Banker, Virtual Strategy Magazine, Wall Street & Technology, and InformationWeek. 

Arjun is a member of the distinguished and diverse group of NACD Certified Directors who are committed to advancing the highest standards of boardroom excellence.

column151:
For nearly three decades I’ve been privileged to hold leadership roles in the events/experiential marketing industry, creating dynamic, compelling, and engaging experiences for audiences, fans, and sponsors.   

Working on iconic events such as Macworld Expo, Schneider Electric’s Innovation Summit and Anime Expo, the largest North American anime convention, has allowed me the opportunity to lead cross-functional teams, gain a rich understanding of each individual area, and manage them collectively to achieve the strategic mission of each event.  Working with renowned speakers, well-known brands, world-class venues, and incredibly talented event teams I am proud of my history of producing, launching, and managing successful events of all types and sizes. 

I am thankful for the time I spent on the agency side, which challenged me to view events through a more strategic lens. Supporting clients such as IBM, Oracle, and AbbVie I analyzed and improved the effectiveness of their portfolios and developed strategies to help them achieve their goals and objectives. 

Inside corporate marketing teams I was able to shape and reimagine face to face marketing tactics through experiential activities, sponsorship activations and innovative event elements. Whether it was an internal leadership event, customer hospitality or user conference the goal of surprising and delighting attendees was always at the forefront. 

 I’ve had the pleasure to share my knowledge at industry events and present at the Women of Isenberg Conference, of which I’m a proud alumnus. It’s my passion and desire is to help mentor and educate the next generation of event professionals. 

 Outside of my professional life I’m blessed to have an amazing husband and family (including two lovable canines), with whom I spend as much time as possible. If I’m not at a yoga class, kayaking or reading I'm likely cheering on my Boston sports teams or volunteering with Pittie Love Rescue. #adoptdontshop

Computershare Corporate Trust is a market leader with decades of experience as a provider of trustee and sophisticated agency services for private and public companies, investment bankers, asset managers as well as governments and institutions. We offer a wide range of services that fulfill our clients’ unique and emerging needs in corporate and structured finance, debt issuance and mergers and acquisitions (M&A). Computershare Corporate Trust is an industry leader with USD$5.3 trillion of debt under administration, USD$347.8 billion in assets under administration and cross-border capabilities including USD$1.2 trillion in funds movements across 75+ currencies in foreign exchange and distributions. With the acquisition of Wells Fargo CTS in November 2021, Computershare Corporate Trust is among the top providers in the US ranking #1 in CMBS, CRE CLO and top 3 in RMBS, CLO, ABS and Investment Grade, Municipal and Convertible Debt. Our team of more than 2,000 employees continues our commitment to delivering the highest standards of service and value to our entire client base. For more information, visit computershare.com/corporatetrust

Infinity IPS, founded in 2003, is a mortgage industry leader providing end-to-end services and solutions for more than a decade.  We specialize in Mortgage Due Diligence and Pre-Fund and Post-Close QC with additional mortgage services including valuation, risk management, specialized staffing and advisory services to Investment Banks, Originators, Government Agencies, Hedge Funds, Private Equity Funds, Bond Insurers, Regional and Community Banks, Credit Unions, public and private REITs and Mortgage Insurers.

We specialize in securitization audits, performing, re-performing, and non-performing mortgage asset due diligence and secondary market compliance due diligence services. Infinity is one of the oldest and most trusted brands in the Mortgage Due Diligence Market.

I bring over 20 years of extensive experience in the audiovisual industry. As a seasoned professional, I've honed my skills across a broad spectrum of roles, including installer, commissioner, project engineering,  design engineering, programming, project manager, and DSP developer. My commitment to excellence is further underscored by my CTS Certification and the comprehensive range of Crestron, Biamp, and Avixa Certifications I hold. I take pride in working with some of the industry's leading brands, ensuring that our clients have access to the best equipment and technologies.

At Digital AV Pros, we specialize in a variety of services that encompass the entire gamut of AV needs. Expertise includes:

Installation & Integration: Crafting seamless and efficient AV systems that blend with the environment and meet the highest standards of functionality.

Engineering & Project Management: Utilizing advanced technical knowledge and organizational skills to ensure projects are executed flawlessly from start to finish.

CAD Design: Creating detailed and precise CAD drawings that serve as the blueprint for successful project implementation.

Service & Maintenance: Offering reliable and prompt support to ensure your AV systems are always at peak performance.

Rack Integration & Systems Commissioning: Ensuring the heart of your AV systems is professionally integrated and commissioned for optimal performance.

Structured Cabling: Implementing robust cabling solutions that form the reliable backbone of any AV system.

Control System & DSP Programming: Tailoring systems to your specific needs through expert programming, providing ease of use and high functionality.


Dedication to Quality
My philosophy revolves around delivering unparalleled quality and customer satisfaction. Every project is treated with the utmost professionalism and dedication. I believe in building lasting relationships with clients, ensuring they receive the best service tailored to their needs.
column44:
At Crestron, we're creating automation solutions that transform the way people live their lives, making their day-to-day tasks easier and improving efficiency and productivity. We strive to be at the forefront of cutting-edge technology, constantly offering faster, better solutions that address the needs of customers the world over. We offer scalable and customized solutions, gaining 24/7 global service and support, and sponsoring products that are designed and manufactured in America.

column151:
I help Bev-Alc brands and their distributors streamline complex marketing operations, stay compliant, and activate hyper-local campaigns that drive growth where it counts — at the shelf, on the menu, and in the moment.

As VP of Business Development at Ansira, I work with brand, sales, and marketing teams to bring order to chaos. Whether you’re navigating the 3-tier system, juggling national and local campaigns, or trying to track fund usage across dozens of distributor partners — I help you solve for it.

Our modular platform gives you visibility, control, and scalability across your entire ecosystem — from brand asset management and compliance to digital media activation and performance tracking. And because we know Bev-Alc is unlike any other industry, our solution is built with flexibility, localization, and legal nuance in mind.

Here's how I can help:

🍺 Centralize Brand Assets & Campaigns – Empower distributors with ready-to-use, compliant assets that reflect your brand’s standards

🍷 Simplify Fund Management – Track, allocate, and report on marketing spend across partners with ease

🍻 Scale Hyper-Local Activation – Reach the right consumers with campaigns that actually get executed — on-premise, off-premise, and everywhere in between

🥃 Drive Efficiency & Results – Eliminate operational drag so your teams can spend more time growing the business

I bring 15+ years of experience in retail, media, and martech — and a deep understanding of what it takes to build scalable strategies that work across distributed networks. I’ve helped brands unlock over $5B in revenue through smarter systems, better partnerships, and a relentless focus on execution.

When I'm not talking shop, you’ll find me outdoors, traveling and getting lost in a new city, or hosting roundtables on what’s next in commerce and brand marketing.

If you're looking to simplify your marketing operations and activate smarter at scale — let's connect!

Reporting directly to the CEO & Founder as head of sales, customer success, customer experience and brand strategy, my responsibility was to drive customer growth and manage retention through critical functional areas. column56:
SproutLoud is the leading Brand-to-Local, Through Channel Marketing Automation platform that gives Enterprise brands and their local partners a distributed marketing solution that is fast, easy, and built to deliver results. By empowering stakeholders in local markets (dealers, retailers, agents, distributors and more) with resources to market locally, brands deliver exceptional, consistent and revenue-generating brand-to-local consumer experiences.

Our software combines channel marketing automation technology, advanced business intelligence, world-class Marketing-Service Integrations, support & exceptional service.

Reporting to the COO and CFO, I directed and managed engagement efforts to drive new subscriptions to automated marketing solutions available to SMB customers (partners). Responsible for building, hiring, and managing our customer engagement (inside sales) and customer success (account management) teams, in addition to developing the strategy, processes and workflows to achieve customer growth in new subscriptions and retention, between both core teams.
column119: Ansira, a leading independent, global marketing technology and services company with proprietary channel, website, and advertising technology platforms, guides companies operating in distributed ecosystems to connect with their customers, fostering unwavering brand loyalty by seamlessly integrating digital and physical experiences from the enterprise to hyper-local level. Ansira's innovative blend of human expertise and cutting-edge technology solutions solves the challenges faced by global marketers today and drives demand for their businesses.
column151:
Strategic Sales Leader | Helping Enterprise Companies Deliver Exceptional Brand-to-Local Experiences

My passion lies in building and executing strategies that impact all touchpoints of the customer journey - from initial conversations to converting loyal clients. I've been provided opportunities to execute this both in-house at organizations, as well as help leading Enterprise companies implement this for their own teams. Over the last decade, I've held both leadership positions and individual contributor roles, and "player-coach" roles, honing in on my ability to create and set a vision, outline & manage deliverables, and tackle situations head on. Delivering above what is expected is the standard I live by. Additional passions include: building relationships, coaching teams, solving problems through technology, learning, storytelling, and watching customers soar through the journey we intentionally create for them.

CBRE Group, Inc. (NYSE:CBRE), a Fortune 500 and S&P 500 company headquartered in Los Angeles, is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm (based on 2017 revenue). column119:
TransUnion is a global information and insights company that makes trust possible in the modern economy. We do this by providing an actionable picture of each person so they can be reliably represented in the marketplace.  As a result, businesses and consumers can transact with confidence and achieve great things.  

This picture is grounded in our legacy as a credit reporting agency which enables us to tap into both credit and public record data; our data fusion methodology that helps us link, match and tap into the awesome combined power of that data; and our knowledgeable and passionate team, who stewards the information with expertise, and in accordance with local legislation around the world. 

A leading presence in more than 30 countries across five continents, TransUnion provides solutions that help create economic opportunity, great experiences and personal empowerment for hundreds of millions of people.

We call this Information for Good® — it’s our purpose, and what drives us every day.

Contact Us
Customer support: https://transu.co/60024D64I
Business support: https://transu.co/60044D67G

This picture is grounded in our legacy as a credit reporting agency which enables us to tap into both credit and public record data; our data fusion methodology that helps us link, match and tap into the awesome combined power of that data; and our knowledgeable and passionate team, who stewards the information with expertise, and in accordance with local legislation around the world. 

A leading presence in more than 30 countries across five continents, TransUnion provides solutions that help create economic opportunity, great experiences and personal empowerment for hundreds of millions of people.

We call this Information for Good® — it’s our purpose, and what drives us every day.

Contact Us
Customer support: https://transu.co/60024D64I
Business support: https://transu.co/60044D67G
column151:
Former Fintech co-founder turned corporate.

With a background in finance, investment management, Product and technology, I have the skills to understand complex markets and identify opportunities to drive revenue growth and market share.

Our team brings Transunion's industry leading solutions to Fintech clients. Working together, we accelerate business growth and efficiency by first making sure we deeply understand their current state and needs. We achieve strategic objectives designing solutions that optimize TransUnion’s unique data assets and platforms (i.e. ID solutions, marketing, fraud risk mitigation, credit risk mitigation). 

Growing up in France and having lived in 4 countries on 3 continents, my global and multicultural background helps me to be an active listener, a creative mind and business problem solver. 

I graduated with a MBA from CSULB and gained a several certifications throughout my career; specifically, I am a FINRA series 65 and is a CAIA Charter Holder. 

I am a results-driven, strategic thinker with a proven ability to build successful business units, lead cross-functional teams, and achieve aggressive revenue targets. I am passionate about developing talent, mentoring junior staff, and fostering a culture of excellence. 

As another imperfect human on the planet, I'm passionate about all things basketball, long distance running, yoga, healthy living, cooking with family, hikes and the beach.

Looking forward to connecting, drop me a line at lionel.tapiero@transunion.com.

I was hired to drive VMware’s transformation from a license-based revenue model to an annual recurring revenue (SaaS) model. In this role, I set business goals and sales strategy as a key member of the Executive Leadership Team and lead a team of 500 distributed across North America and LATAM. I lead functional areas including Sales, Solution Architects, Business Development, and Partner Management.

SELECT RESULTS:
⇨ Grew revenue 500% in 3 years by investing heavily in software service provider partnerships to create co-selling routes to market that included other hyper sellers such as Google, Microsoft, and AWS. I personally established partnerships with Google and Microsoft, which had reached multi-million-dollar value in under a year, and grew the existing AWS partnership 600%. 
⇨ Increased customer consumption 68% YoY for 3 years by developing data-backed growth projections that I used to direct sales teams to overachieve targets based on the percentage of committed but non-consuming customers identified in projections. 
⇨ Tripled the core sales team’s adoption and sales of cloud solutions by incentivizing co-selling between core and specialty sales teams and creating use cases that trained core teams on how best to sell cloud solutions. 
⇨ Improved sales efficiency 275% through customer propensity analysis that identified the companies most likely to adopt cloud solutions. 
⇨ Piloted transformational leadership series on growth mindset that was later rolled out company-wide, putting the Cloud organization on the leading edge of VMware’s leadership development.
⇨ Maintained less than 10% employee attrition by conducting innovative “stay interviews” with key talent to determine what factors would keep them engaged with the team, empowering proactive retention strategies.

Wolters Kluwer (EURONEXT: WKL) is a global leader in professional information, software solutions, and services for the healthcare, tax and accounting, financial and corporate compliance, legal and regulatory, and corporate performance and ESG sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.   

Wolters Kluwer reported 2024 annual revenues of €5.9 billion. The group serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries, and employs approximately 21,000 people worldwide. The company is headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands.

Beware of Recruitment Fraud! 🔒

Scammers may pose as Wolters Kluwer, offering fake job opportunities and requesting personal info or payments. Protect yourself:
- Apply only via our secure Workday hub on our Careers page.
- Our recruiters never ask for banking info or payments.
- We don't use public email accounts (e.g., Hotmail, Yahoo, Gmail). 

Report suspected fraud: thirdpartyincident@wolterskluwer.com. If you've made a payment, contact local authorities.

Read more here - https://careers.wolterskluwer.com/en/recruitment-fraud-alert

Arch Insurance Group Inc., a division of Arch Capital Group Ltd. (ACGL), is a market-leading specialty insurer.

We provide a wide range of property, casualty and specialty insurance for corporations, professional firms and financial institutions across the United States and Canada.

Our insurance group in North America consists of Arch Insurance Company, Arch Specialty Insurance Company and Arch Excess & Surplus Insurance Company. Arch Insurance Group's executive offices are located in New York City, with regional offices located in New York City (Northeast Region), Atlanta (Southeast Region), Chicago (Central Region) and San Francisco (Western Region), as well as other offices throughout the U.S. to support our business. Arch Insurance Company also operates a branch office in Toronto, Canada.

ACGL is a Bermuda public limited liability company that provides insurance, reinsurance and mortgage insurance on a worldwide basis through operations in Bermuda, the United States, Canada, Europe, Australia and Hong Kong.

I have been working with software developers and other IT professionals for over a decade. During that time, I've worn many hats including Product Manager, Product Owner, Project Manager, Scrum Master, QA Tester, Usability Researcher / UI Designer, Business Analyst (BA), Data Analyst, and IT Hiring Coordinator. 

Places I've worked have varied from small start-up sized companies to large organizations and have included a $1B online retailer, a subsidiary of a Fortune 500 insurance company, a major 4-year university, and a subcontractor for the US government. 

I have been involved in various levels of organizations interacting with software engineering including coordination of developer and tester hiring, the initial implementation of Scrum, expanding from one Scrum team to two, setting up a Business Analyst team that reported to me, and creating and implementing a company-wide project management framework. 

I am very devoted to Agile principles and have a passion for clarifying and establishing product vision.

I consider myself an insightful, organized professional who excels at servant leadership.

Arch Insurance Group Inc., a division of Arch Capital Group Ltd. (ACGL), is a market-leading specialty insurer.

We provide a wide range of property, casualty and specialty insurance for corporations, professional firms and financial institutions across the United States and Canada.

Our insurance group in North America consists of Arch Insurance Company, Arch Specialty Insurance Company and Arch Excess & Surplus Insurance Company. Arch Insurance Group's executive offices are located in New York City, with regional offices located in New York City (Northeast Region), Atlanta (Southeast Region), Chicago (Central Region) and San Francisco (Western Region), as well as other offices throughout the U.S. to support our business. Arch Insurance Company also operates a branch office in Toronto, Canada.

ACGL is a Bermuda public limited liability company that provides insurance, reinsurance and mortgage insurance on a worldwide basis through operations in Bermuda, the United States, Canada, Europe, Australia and Hong Kong.

Wolters Kluwer (EURONEXT: WKL) is a global leader in professional information, software solutions, and services for the healthcare, tax and accounting, financial and corporate compliance, legal and regulatory, and corporate performance and ESG sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.   

Wolters Kluwer reported 2024 annual revenues of €5.9 billion. The group serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries, and employs approximately 21,000 people worldwide. The company is headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands.

Beware of Recruitment Fraud! 🔒

Scammers may pose as Wolters Kluwer, offering fake job opportunities and requesting personal info or payments. Protect yourself:
- Apply only via our secure Workday hub on our Careers page.
- Our recruiters never ask for banking info or payments.
- We don't use public email accounts (e.g., Hotmail, Yahoo, Gmail). 

Report suspected fraud: thirdpartyincident@wolterskluwer.com. If you've made a payment, contact local authorities.

Read more here - https://careers.wolterskluwer.com/en/recruitment-fraud-alert

I am a global executive with demonstrated expertise in building and executing comprehensive business transformation plans to deliver results that outperform expectations.  I achieve this by analyzing where business shortfalls are occurring, evaluating team strengths to determine what resources are needed to operate at peak performance, and laying the groundwork to reinvigorate or turn around the challenged business and stimulate growth.  

Currently, I am the CEO of Wolters Kluwer Financial and Corporate Compliance (FCC) Division, overseeing the strategy and execution for this $1.4B business unit comprised of 3 primary business units. FCC provides expert services and solutions to help financial services and corporate professionals maintain ongoing compliance requirements, increase efficiency and produce better business outcomes

I have experience leading acquisitions and reinvigorating mature businesses, navigating complex turnarounds and transformations.  Through these varied experiences, I have gained significant insight on how to fuel growth, enable faster and more efficient scalable innovation across multi-cultural organizations, and engage teams to achieve top performance.

Career Highlights:

► Increased Equifax International growth trajectory to 11%, fueled by a material and complex acquisition of Boa Vista in Brazil, completing the EFX Cloud journey in most regions and leveraging those investments to drive scaleable new product innovation leveraged across multiple regions.  

► Built comprehensive business transformation plan, establishing clear focus for the Equifax Australia/New Zealand organization, targeting 3 core priorities of stabilizing the core, driving growth, and improving channel and service availability.  

► Despite the impact of Covid-19 on the business, rallied the Equifax Australia/New Zealand teams to fuel client engagements leading to significant increases in the new business pipeline and generating a 29% YOY increase in net new revenue. Thoughtfully managed change to improve employee engagement by 30% from 2018 to 2020.

► As President of Equifax Canada, I tripled the annual growth of the business and expanded margins by focusing on 3 key enablers: increasing employee engagement, creating positive customer experiences, and driving innovation for customers.

Zelis Insights and Empowerment division, part of Zelis Healthcare's industry-leading platform serving over 700 payers and nearly 2.5 million providers nationwide, transforms healthcare economics and member experiences by engaging members before care decisions are made. 

We've recognized that the most impactful cost savings and satisfaction improvements occur proactively, allowing us to simultaneously advance the Triple Aim—improving population health, enhancing patient experience, and reducing per capita costs. Our unique combination of network insights and member empowerment tools enables health plans to achieve better outcomes and economics, creating sustainable value across the healthcare ecosystem.

column9:
As Vice President of Sales for Insights & Empowerment at Zelis, I lead with a passion for healthcare innovation, strategic growth, and data-driven decision-making. In this role, I partner with payers and other healthcare stakeholders to deliver cutting-edge solutions that transform member engagement, optimize network performance, and unlock actionable insights through advanced analytics.

With nearly 20 years of experience in healthcare and enterprise sales, I’ve built a track record of success by aligning client goals with scalable strategies—accelerating performance, reducing costs, and enhancing outcomes across the healthcare ecosystem. At Zelis, I’m proud to be at the forefront of driving smarter, more transparent, and more connected solutions in an increasingly complex landscape.

I thrive at the intersection of strategy, innovation, and collaboration—whether that means crafting consultative sales approaches, fostering long-term client relationships, or mentoring high-performing teams.

Let’s connect if you’re looking to exchange ideas on healthcare transformation, payer solutions, or how data can drive better decisions for everyone in the system.

column118: "​In a free state, there should always be an inquirer asking on behalf of the people."​ -John Norvell, 1829
column119:
Since 1829, The Philadelphia Inquirer has been “asking on behalf of the people” of Philadelphia and the region by providing essential journalism. Locally owned and headquartered in Center City Philadelphia, The Inquirer is a for-profit public benefit corporation under the non-profit Lenfest Institute. Its multiple brand platforms — including newspapers, Inquirer.com, e-Editions, apps, newsletters, podcasts, and live events — provide Pulitzer Prize-winning journalism to a growing audience that includes more than 180,000 subscribers and 20 million monthly impressions. For more information, visit about.inquirer.com.

“In a free state, there should always be an inquirer asking on behalf of the people: Why? Why? Why?” — John Norvell, Inquirer co-founder

column118: We’re a leading hospitality solutions provider proudly serving premier hotels and healthcare systems nationwide.
column119:
As the leading tech-enabled, multi-service hospitality solutions provider serving over 800 hotel and healthcare clients nationwide, Towne Park has been providing exceptional parking, mobility and hospitality experiences from arrival through departure for over 35 years. We make the customer experience a priority, providing seamless and memorable interactions that create smiles. 

Towne Park is a trusted partner to more of the country’s top hotels, including 4-star and 5-star properties, and prominent healthcare systems than any other provider. From boutique hotels and sprawling luxury resorts to downtown healthcare campuses and local medical centers, we have a demonstrated track record of providing guests, patients and visitors with a distinctive, on-brand experience, while driving better performance and revenue for our clients. 

Providing exceptional experiences that make someone smile requires a passion and a commitment for service. We recruit, hire, train, develop and engage service all-stars who are dedicated to creating distinctive guest experiences. Our teams act as a superior representation of our clients’ brands, making customers want to return again and again.

Delivering experiences that exceed expectations also requires the best of leading-edge technology to maximize results. Our technology platform is based on data to provide key insights for informed decision-making and enables us to deliver innovative solutions that drive demand, maximize revenue, enhance operational performance, and create seamless client, customer, and employee experiences.

The service our teams deliver, paired with our tech-enabled solutions, allow us to provide a differentiated experience for every customer we meet — one that is convenient, personal, and memorable.

She optimizes stakeholder relations to amplify brand presence and drive revenue growth.  Victoria developed her skills through advising numerous corporate, nonprofit and government clients at several international public relations agencies.

In an always-on world, teams trust PagerDuty to help them deliver an optimal digital experience to their customers, every time. PagerDuty is the central nervous system for a company’s digital operations. We identify issues and opportunities in real-time and bring together the right people to respond to problems faster and prevent them in the future. From digital disruptors to Fortune 500 companies, over 18,000 businesses rely on PagerDuty to help them continually improve their digital operations—so their teams can spend less time reacting to incidents and more time building for the future.

Dutonians believe that we are a part of a bigger movement of businesses being built to benefit everyone—the customer and the employee, as well as our community. We are go-getters fueled by the fire to reinvent how people and companies work together. We take the lead and get creative to be first in the hearts of our customers. Whether it’s keeping the world on or changing it entirely, Dutonians are fueled by the fire to reinvent how people and companies work together to deliver in real-time, across the globe.

Join us to lead uncharted efforts and reinvent how companies run.

I'm a real go-getter who's known for tackling challenges and seizing opportunities without a blink. Doing what's never been done before or what others find almost impossible excites me. I enjoy driving success, and I know that people are the most vital ingredient in results. That's why training and coaching is at the heart of my management style. The process of seeing incoming sales representatives grow in their skill and capability is truly fulfilling. I am proud to have played a role in shaping the careers and performance of dozens of quality sales professionals. Moreover, I am thrilled to have mobilized talent to tackle corporate goals in major advertising and media markets!

I also value relationships, and I know how hard it can be to retain them in such a competitive environment. Clients and prospects have choices, and I work hard to give them the confidence to consistently choose the organization I represent. I have achieved high rates of account acquisition and customer renewals, and I credit that to the trust, communication and intention with which I treat people.

column118: We promise to always be here, helping you prepare for tomorrow so you can live better today.
column119:
Our company was founded by Watson Powell in 1929 as American Republic Insurance Company. From the beginning with 200 charter policies, our company was dedicated to providing personal insurance services at an affordable price. 

Through sound fiscal responsibility, our young company survived the Great Depression, which came just six months later. By 1945, our company moved beyond our Iowa borders to do business in a second state, Minnesota, rapidly followed by more states. And today, Wellabe’s six insurance companies are licensed in 49 states and the District of Columbia and are recognized by AM Best as having excellent financial strength. 

Mr. Powell’s vision was to create a company founded on the principal of caring. While we have seen tremendous growth over the years, that same caring attitude has carried on to today and will continue to carry on for the next 100 years.

We are in a people helping people business, and our entire team is dedicated to always being here for our customers. That’s actually where the name Wellabe comes from – the phrase “we’ll always be.” We’ll always be here for our customers, fulfilling our promises and helping them be well. Even nearly 95 years later, we are still caring for our customers, pushing boundaries, embracing growth, and transforming our organization.

At Legacy Restoration, we do more than repair and replace home exteriors – roofing, windows, siding, and gutters - we provide a guided experience for homeowners and property managers from start to finish. We serve residential homeowners and property owners of multi-family properties. Whether you're addressing storm damage or planning exterior improvements, our goal is to make the process easier while delivering exceptional results and peace of mind. 
 
Legacy is known for our expertise, integrity, and unwavering commitment to quality. We believe that quality, trust and transparent communication are the cornerstones of every successful project. Our commitment goes beyond excellence, to serving our employees, our local communities and our customers. 
 
Recognized as one of the Top 100 Roofing Contractors in the U.S., we've earned awards for ethics, service excellence, and community involvement. But for us, the true measure of success is the lasting relationships we create—one home, one family, one community at a time. Let Legacy Restoration be your trusted partner in building a better, stronger and more beautiful home exterior.  
 
Legacy Restoration is based in Minneapolis, MN and serves Minneapolis, MN; St Cloud, MN; Rochester, MN; Chicago, IL; Denver, CO; Des Moines, IA; and Omaha, NE. With a commitment to quality craftsmanship and a five-star customer experience, Legacy Restoration has become the trusted name in the home exterior industry. The company offers a wide range of services, including roofing, windows, siding and gutters. To learn more visit www.legacyrestorationllc.com.

In the world of roofing and exterior restoration services, one must always be ready for the next turn. My career has been shaped by the challenge of anticipating that next turn and leading transformative change to position my organizations for long-term success.

I am a passionate and performance-driven leader, translating vision into action and value. My extensive experience in the roofing and exterior restoration, automotive, insurance, and fleet service industries has honed my abilities to lead operational excellence, organizational change, and business growth in the US and internationally. I leverage strong strategic insight, a results-oriented mindset, and team-building skills to achieve goals and build high-performance teams.

My deep experience in restoration, automotive, and property and casualty insurance claims has provided me with unique insights into the drivers of cost and customer satisfaction. I also have hands-on leadership in operations, network management, technology implementation, sales, and marketing.

Throughout my career, I have successfully led strategic transformations of organizations, including before, during, and after significant transactions, both acquisitions and sales. I have substantial P&L responsibility, and am known for delivering operational improvement, and managing with a fine-tuned appreciation for “running the business” concurrent with “changing the business.”

People are the heartbeat of any successful organization, and I am deeply committed to fostering a climate and culture that drive motivation and performance. My portfolio also includes successful human capital and talent development initiatives.

I am now recognizing a stronger alignment of my deepest background and passion with new professional opportunities at significant leadership levels. Each challenge and opportunity is uniquely defined by its customers, people, culture, products, and business model, while the broad lessons and experiences of my career position me well to succeed in this environment.

column119:
At Camin Cargo, we provide inspection, laboratory testing, and additive treatment solutions to the Petroleum Industry. With 67 branches serving key ports and blending hubs across North, South, and Central America, the Caribbean, and Europe, we have been providing ethical, reliable, and comprehensive service for over 40 years. 

Our focus is maintaining the highest level of service, quality, and customer satisfaction throughout our industry as we continue to grow our presence. To perform at the highest standards, we are continuously evaluating our services to meet and surpass the growing demands required by our clients. 

We are proud to institute the highest level of business responsiveness to achieve efficient, adaptive performance in today’s energy sector. Our expertise covers the oil and gas, petrochemicals, renewables (including biofuels, RD and SAF), and agriculture markets. 

As your independent third-party inspection provider, we determine and certify quantity and quality for custody transfers of bulk liquid, gaseous, and dry cargoes. The qualities of our field staff are mirrored and complemented by our operations team and laboratory staff.  

Our inspection and laboratory services are performed with strict adherence to the latest American Petroleum Institute (API) and American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) standards, government regulations, and industry protocols. 

Bonded with U.S. Customs and Border Protection 
ISO 9001:2000 Certified 
ISO 17025:2005 Accredited 
BQ 9000 Certified 
EPA registered for Fuels Testing 
Approved by the New York Mercantile Exchange 
Active members of ASTM, API, EI, IFIA, ASQ, GAFTA, FOSFA, ISO, AOCS and ACS
column151:
I am currently the Chief Executive Officer of Camin Cargo Control, an internationally recognized Testing, Inspection & Certification company, since February 1st 2025. Prior to joining Camin Cargo Controls, I was the President and Chief Executive Officer Centurion Group Limited, a global rental and services platform backed by SCF Partners. Prior to Centurion Group, I was the President and Chief Executive Officer of Tesco Corporation (NASDAQ:TESO) until its sale to Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR) in 2017; and prior thereto I served in multiple regional and global positions within Schlumberger and Technip. In summary, I have more than 30 years of experience in the energy industry in various roles and capacities and I has extensive international experience within the energy industry, including direct involvement in operations in the United States, Canada, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East, Africa, Southeast Asia and Australia.

I am also currently serving in the Enerflex (TSX:EFX) Board as an independent director. 
 
In addition, I also served as a Director of the Greater Houston Partnership* pro-bono between January 2016 and February 2018, which provided me an opportunity to impact broad and highly relevant socioeconomic issues.

column119:
Since 1988, MedWatch has been a leader in providing concierge member advocacy and medical cost containment solutions for TPAs, employer groups, school systems, municipalities, hospital systems, Taft-Hartley plans, and fully insured payers as well as for the reinsurance industry and stop loss carriers.
 
MedWatch has maintained continuous URAC Accreditation for Health Utilization Management since 1997, Case Management since 2000, and Disease Management since 2007. These core services, along with all of our proven solutions, focus on appropriateness and quality of care, helping to achieve the best clinical and financial outcomes for plans and plan members.
 
MedWatch’s programs fit together seamlessly to support members along the entire continuum of their health journey. Pathways Concierge, our white-glove service, provides members with a single point of contact to address questions about their health plan. It’s the starting point and finish line for successful member engagement and effective utilization of benefits. In addition to Pathways Concierge and our URAC Accredited core services, MedWatch offers over 30 advocacy and cost containment solutions including dialysis claims repricing, diabetic monitoring and intervention, high-cost infusion/oncology treatment savings, in and out of network savings for high-cost claims, and more.
 
MedWatch is the Right Choice for providing the Right Care at the Right Time in the Right Place for the Right Cost. Learn how MedWatch’s proven solutions, innovative approach and clinical expertise make us the Right Partner for you: Visit urmedwatch.com.

I collaborate directly with C-Suite executives at claim payers to address their cost containment needs. My expertise encompasses utilization management, case management, disease management, and wellness services for self-funded, fully insured, and carrier clients, offering personalized and customizable healthcare solutions for both behavioral and medical health plans. I work closely with TPAs, health plans, welfare funds, and clients to identify and implement cost containment solutions that provide a return on investment by saving plan dollars without compromising the quality of patient care. I also manage vendor relationships and partnerships to deliver comprehensive solutions for total population management.

I excel in high-level consultative and strategic oversight for complex new and existing accounts, developing innovative solutions as needed while achieving client retention and service targets.

Additional experience with selling and upselling a suite of cost containment services. These services include analytics-based solutions, payment and revenue integrity, surprise billing, data and decision science, provider payment, and network services such as reference-based pricing.

I am pleased to now be associated with MedWatch, LLC. Offering clients a full-service concierge member advocacy and medical cost containment solutions that protect the financial integrity of the health. Additionally, the solutions improve the clinical health and medical outcomes for the member. Please connect with me to learn more!

column118: We provide the payments infrastructure that allows Canadians, their businesses and their institutions to exchange value.
column119:
The Canadian economy depends on the exchange of billions of dollars each day. Payments Canada is responsible for the clearing and settlement infrastructure, processes and rules essential to those transactions.

We are delegated by the Government of Canada to support a vibrant economy by helping to meet the payment needs of consumers and business, and empowering a new era of modern payments.

We're headquartered in Ottawa, with an office in Toronto, employing more than 300 full-time staff and operating under a board of directors. We are a public purpose, non-profit organization fully funded by the financial institutions that participate in our systems.
column151: The digital banking and digital payments landscape is transforming rapidly. Always, the customer experience and the employee experience matter. Generally, expectations change faster then most models can keep up. Working together we can create a brighter future.... of doing business, of serving customers and of serving employees. How well we do that is up to us.

column29: Vice President, Business Development at STS Aviation Group
column32:
STS Engineering Solutions, LLC is one of 9 STS Aviation Group Divisions. 

In Brief the STS Aviation Group is comprised of:

STS Engineering Solutions - Provides 24/7 access to DER’s/Engineers and contract/supplemental engineering staff of every discipline and delegation.  We offer AOG support, Repair Development, DTA, PMA authorization, Heavy Check Liaison support, and full project support through completion/STC. 

•DER support with 8110 approvals for major repairs and alterations. Structural, Electrical, Systems, Mechanical, and Materials/processes. 

•Electrical Load Analysis to support aircraft upgrades and EWIS compliance. 

•Development of alternate materials for Aerospatiale material systems reference on Airbus, ATR, and Embrear aircraft platforms. 

•Development of a variety of STC's for interiors, systems, and structures. 

•Development of repair data to support non-serial specific repairs. 

•Development of analysis and engineering data to support PMA efforts. 

•NDE/NDT certification development. 

•Development of FQCS and other quality systems (AS9100 C) for various clients. 

•Repair station and Part 121 compliance support. 

STS Component Solutions – Provides 24/7 inventory/component solutions, AOG component support. We are the authorized distributor/re-seller for numerous OEM’s such as; Zodiac Aerospace Galleys, Esterline, Marathon-Norco, Acme, Perkins, and Avionic Instruments and others.

STS Line Maintenance – FAA/EASA 145 Repair Station - Provides 24/7 scheduled and on call maintenance at currently 28 stations throughout the USA. We also provide modification services such as the AirCell WiFi Mods, and the Rockwell Collins TCAS II. We can open stations in under 30 days and can cover all airframes. Repair Station #Q6TR841X.

STS AeroStaff Services – Provides every skill set of aviation maintenance personnel on a contract or direct hire basis. These technicians can support any operation domestically or abroad.
column56:
Since 1981, STS has provided mechanics to meet the needs of the aviation industry -- a record of experience that is unmatched.

From international carriers to regional and commuter airlines, manufacturers, cargo carriers, charter operators, maintenance bases and FBO's, we've served the entire field.

From North and South America to Europe, Africa and the Pacific Rim, we've supported the operations of clients the world over.

Most of all, STS has earned an outstanding reputation for delivering quality and experience: When you need it, wherever you need it, for as long (or as briefly) as you need it.
column67: Maintained, troubleshot, and repaired all environmental and electrical components on numerous military aircraft to include C-130’s, KC-135’s, F-15’s, F-16’s, and A-10 aircraft.  Involved in post flight pilot briefings to determine the nature of any repairs needed.  Responsible for signing off on all repairs completed prior to aircraft inspection currently assigned to the Inactive Ready Reserve (IRR)
column118: "Total Solutions to Keep You Flying!"
column119:
Whether you’re looking for aviation mechanics, engineers, line maintenance support or the aircraft and engine components needed to keep you flying, STS Aviation Group dedicates itself to taking your business from where it is now to where it needs to be.

Founded more than two decades ago, STS has grown from humble beginnings to become a global powerhouse in the aerospace industry.

column118: We are a proudly public institution that serves others by putting academic excellence to good use. #GreatAndGood #UVA
column119: The University of Virginia was founded in 1819 as the model for modern universities that has since been emulated all over the world. After 200 years, this iconic institution of higher learning endures because it is fully immersed in meeting the greatest challenges of our time, day in and day out. It’s how we fulfill our animating purpose – to serve. UVA is Virginia’s flagship institution of higher learning, perennially ranked as one of the best public universities in the nation. Having the best public college financial aid package and the highest graduation rate in the nation, UVA offers a life-changing return on investment for students from all backgrounds. We promote access so a meritocracy of talent can participate in shaping our society. The revolutionary vision of an Academical Village has evolved to 12 Schools, each providing leadership in its field and attracting world-class talent. The University is the largest employer in the region and is a catalyst for growth across the Commonwealth, generating an annual economic impact of $5.9 billion. Ultimately, we prepare students to be citizen-leaders who themselves are guided by empathy, integrity, and truth. We believe that doing what you do best, for the benefit of others, is where greatness comes from. Which is why, at the University of Virginia, we strive to be great and good in all we do. #GreatandGood #UVA

column119:
At TEGNA Inc. (NYSE: TGNA), our mission is clear: We help people thrive in their local communities by providing the trusted local news and services that matter most. Together, we are building a sustainable future for local news. 

With 64 television stations in 51 U.S. markets, TEGNA reaches more than 100 million people on an average monthly basis across the web, mobile apps, streaming, and linear television. Each TEGNA station has Roku and Amazon Fire TV apps, offering live and on-demand news, weather and sports coverage. 

TEGNA produces trusted, impactful and innovative content across platforms. We tell stories that matter, act as an advocate for those in need and help bring positive change to our communities. Our award-winning journalists have been recognized with numerous national honors including Edward R. Murrow, Alfred I. duPont, George Foster Peabody, George Polk, Walter Cronkite and Emmy awards.

In everything we do, we are driven by our strongly held values: 

We demand the truth. 
We work smarter.
We do the right thing.  
We win.

TEGNA is the largest owner of top four network affiliates in the top 25 markets among independent station groups, and own the leading multicast networks True Crime Network, Twist and Quest. We offer innovative solutions to help businesses reach consumers across television, digital and over-the-top (OTT) platforms, including Premion, our OTT advertising service.
column151:
Mike Steib is CEO of TEGNA Inc (NYSE:TGNA), a leading local technology and media company that owns and operates 64 broadcast stations in 51 U.S. markets.

Previously, Mike was CEO of Artsy, the leading online marketplace for buying and selling art from galleries, auction houses, and collectors in over 100 countries around the world. During his tenure, the team developed the most popular app in the art world, significantly accelerated revenue growth, and achieved operating profitability.

Prior to Artsy, Mike was the CEO of XO Group Inc. (NYSE: XOXO), parent company of The Knot, where he and the team developed America’s most-used and highest-rated wedding planning app and two-sided local vendor marketplace, culminating in a 300% total shareholder return over his five-year tenure as CEO.

Earlier in his career, Steib served in roles at Google, NBCUniversal, Vente-Privee USA, Walker Digital, and McKinsey & Company.

From 2014 until 2024, Mike served on the board of directors of Ally Financial (NYSE: Ally), a Fortune 500 digital financial services company that helps millions of Americans save, invest, and borrow for their most important purchases, where he chaired Ally’s Digital Transformation and Technology Committees, and served on the Risk Committee.

Doing his best to serve the community, Mike has served as chairman of the board of Change.org, a global platform for social change, chairman of the board of Literacy Partners, a free adult literacy and family support service for underprivileged New Yorkers, and chairman of the board of Career Gear, helping disadvantaged and previously incarcerated men return to the workforce.

Mike also seeks to contribute insights and advice on business leadership and career development. He was the host of Office Hours with Mike Steib (2023-2024), a production of iHeartMedia, the #1 podcast publisher in the world, during which he interviewed the founders and chief executives shaping our world. He is also the author of The Career Manifesto (Penguin Random House, 2018), a guide for young professionals seeking more purpose and joy in their careers. Steib’s work has been featured on NBC's Today show, Good Morning America, CNN, CNBC, Bloomberg, and Fox Business, as well as in The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Harvard Business Review, Fortune, Entrepreneur, TechCrunch, Fast Company, and others. 

Mike received a BA in Economics and a BA in International Relations from the University of Pennsylvania.

Xometry is a leading AI-enabled marketplace for on-demand manufacturing, transforming one of the largest industries in the world. It is a public company listed on NASDAQ (symbol: XMTR). 

With its proprietary technology, Xometry creates a marketplace that enables designers and engineers to rapidly source high-quality on-demand manufactured parts and assemblies. Xometry's innovative platform also empowers sellers of manufacturing services across the nation to grow their businesses. Xometry’s buyers range from self-funded startups to Fortune 100 companies.

Xometry’s online quoting portal and network of thousands of manufacturing facilities helps ensure fast lead times while offering a broad array of capabilities, including CNC Machining, 3D Printing, Injection Molding, Sheet Metal Fabrication, Sheet Cutting and Casting.

She is passionate about leveraging data and innovative technologies, including AI, to drive sustained value creation. 

Stephany's executive, advisor and board experience also spans corporate strategy, fundraising, investor relations, M&A for public and private companies. She has also participated in the World Economic Forum’s Global Coalition for Value in Healthcare.

Avec des outils innovants conçus autour de vos priorités et une équipe entièrement centrée sur votre réussite, vous obtiendrez les informations dont vous avez besoin pour vous rapprocher encore plus de vos objectifs. 

Cette culture de l'innovation et les valeurs partagées de confiance, de travail d'équipe et de responsabilité sont la raison pour laquelle nous avons été nommés l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada. C'est aussi pourquoi une carrière à la Banque CIBC est plus qu'un emploi : c'est une occasion de grandir et de travailler aux côtés de certaines des personnes plus brillantes au Canada.

column119: GTT is a leading networking and security as a service provider for multinational organizations, simply and securely connecting people and machines to data and applications – anywhere in the world. We serve thousands of organizations, bringing together the right people, partners and technology to reduce the burden on IT teams and solve the most pressing networking and security challenges. Built on our top-ranked global Tier 1 network, GTT Envision is a single global technology platform to connect, orchestrate, virtualize and automate enterprise networks, enabling customers with consumable solutions to achieve business missions and meet ongoing demand when, where and how needed. column118: We believe everyone deserves to move their financial life forward.
column119:
For more than 35 years, Edelman Financial Engines has been helping people move their financial lives forward.

Our founders set the tone for our mission – giving individual investors access to sophisticated investment modeling tools that were previously available only to institutional investors, and providing financial planning and wealth management advice with the belief that everyone should have a trusted financial advocate who is always acting in their best interests. Today, we’re one of America’s top independent wealth planning and workplace investment advisory firms, serving more than 1.3 million clients (as of Dec. 2024).

Our unique combination of high-tech and high-touch services helps people wherever they are on their personal financial journey. Through our Wealth Management services, we deliver straightforward wealth planning and investment advice to help individuals and families connect the dots between key parts of their financial life so they can build, grow, protect and preserve their wealth. Through our Employer Services, we work with many of the nation’s leading employers, offering an integrated suite of personalized financial solutions to support employees across their major life events and milestones – from their first paycheck all the way through retirement.

In serving clients from coast to coast, we know that when individuals have better confidence and command over their own financial journey, this can have a positive lasting impact on families, communities, and generations over time. This mission-driven purpose is deeply embedded in our values, our culture, and across all of our teams.

column118: AI-Powered Risk-Based Quality Management (RBQM) & Data Quality Oversight Solutions
column119:
CluePoints is the premier provider of RBQM and data quality oversight software. We’re leveraging the potential of AI using advanced statistics and ML to determine the quality, accuracy, and integrity of clinical trial data both during and after the study. Aligned with guidance from the FDA, EMA, ICH, and MHRA, CluePoints supports central and on-site monitoring, medical review, and quality risk management to drive a holistic risk-based strategy. 

Coupled with thought leadership and consulting expertise to aid risk assessment and solution implementation, the result is positive clinical development outcomes, increased operational efficiency, lower costs, and reduced regulatory submission risk as part of the industry paradigm shift to RBQM.

To learn more about CluePoints, visit CluePoints.com.

column118: We believe everyone deserves to move their financial life forward.
column119:
For more than 35 years, Edelman Financial Engines has been helping people move their financial lives forward.

Our founders set the tone for our mission – giving individual investors access to sophisticated investment modeling tools that were previously available only to institutional investors, and providing financial planning and wealth management advice with the belief that everyone should have a trusted financial advocate who is always acting in their best interests. Today, we’re one of America’s top independent wealth planning and workplace investment advisory firms, serving more than 1.3 million clients (as of Dec. 2024).

Our unique combination of high-tech and high-touch services helps people wherever they are on their personal financial journey. Through our Wealth Management services, we deliver straightforward wealth planning and investment advice to help individuals and families connect the dots between key parts of their financial life so they can build, grow, protect and preserve their wealth. Through our Employer Services, we work with many of the nation’s leading employers, offering an integrated suite of personalized financial solutions to support employees across their major life events and milestones – from their first paycheck all the way through retirement.

In serving clients from coast to coast, we know that when individuals have better confidence and command over their own financial journey, this can have a positive lasting impact on families, communities, and generations over time. This mission-driven purpose is deeply embedded in our values, our culture, and across all of our teams.
column151:
I am a proven team builder, innovator, and revenue generator who is lucky to have developed left brain and right brain skills over time in equal measure. I love going from data analysis to strategic imperatives to creative ideas and back again. I love the challenges of understanding an audience, really understanding them, and then helping brands connect to them in ways that are additive and meaningful. I've got a robust personal toolkit including business strategy, brand strategy, digital strategy, design thinking, content marketing, influencer marketing and innovation, but the most important thing to me is the people. Whether with clients or team members, great work depends on great collaboration, clear communication, strategic vision and a good sense of humor, and focusing on these are by far my favorite parts of my job.

My career travels so far have allowed me great opportunities with amazing teams, and I've been able to drive growth, introduce new ways of working and influence the culture of teams and organizations to birth greater collaboration and creativity.  I've also had the privilege of leading work and business for a set of amazing brands in financial services, health care, travel, CPG and telecommunications. Over the past 20 years, I've led work for Hershey's, IHG, American Express, Sunoco, Carnival Cruise Lines, Progressive, New Balance, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, Hasbro, Reebok, Comcast, Jack Daniel's, Glidden Paints, AT&T and IBM.

Personally, I am fueled the people around me, great ideas and terrible jokes alike, and the energy that comes from a team trying to look at a problem from a totally new vantage point and reimagine the solution. I am a firm believer that there's always a hidden insight, a new perspective or a better idea to be found.  I can often be found trying to crack my wife and children up, still perfecting my 18 foot jumper or drumming aggressively on my steering wheel during rush hour.

I am a financial services marketing leader with experience building teams, leading transformational efforts, enabling large organizations through marketing program development and driving attributable results for business partners.  I have direct experience with digital, social media, e-mail, direct mail, content strategy and customer journey orchestration.   I have deep experience with sales and marketing integration, enabling sales teams with marketing programs, technology and content.

You can get a better sense for who I am by considering my StrengthsFinder Top 5 Strengths:

1)	Futuristic - one who has a keen sense of using an eye towards the future to drive today's success
2)	Ideation - one who is adept at seeing underlying concepts that unite disparate ideas
3)	Relator - one who is most comfortable with fewer, deeper relationships
4)	Strategic - one who is able to see a clear direction through the complexity of a situation
5)	Analytical - one who requires data and/or proof to make sense of their circumstances

Leveraging these strengths, I approach business problems with a data-driven mindset and find solutions that are rooted in strategy.  Having been in financial services my entire career, I understand the difficulty with executing in a regulated industry.   And, with a history of leading high performing teams, I know how to maximize resources to deliver in an outsized way.

column9:
Chief Growth & Marketing Officer
📍 Dallas, TX (National Role)

As Chief Growth & Marketing Officer at Supreme Lending, I lead with one mission: to enrich lives through intentional growth, people-first leadership, and marketing that matters.

In this role, I’m responsible for driving national expansion, building high-performing teams, and elevating Supreme’s brand presence across the country. I partner closely with our executive team, market leaders, and loan officers to create strategic systems that empower success at every level.

What I Focus On:
🔹 Championing Supreme’s culture of humility, service, and excellence
🔹 Building scalable recruiting initiatives and supporting true P&L branches
🔹 Overseeing national marketing, training, onboarding, and sales enablement
🔹 Streamlining operations to help loan officers move faster and serve better
🔹 Launching campaigns and platforms that tell the real Supreme story

Why It Matters:
Supreme Lending is the mortgage industry's best-kept secret—but not for long. With over two decades of consistency, integrity, and heart, Supreme is built differently—and now we’re telling that story with boldness and clarity.

My Why:
To build, to coach, to inspire, and to serve. I’m here to lead a new era of growth rooted in purpose—and help loan officers, leaders, and teams grow something that lasts.

column122: We are a dedicated team of Mortgage Professionals who strive to offer the best service possible to our customers.
column151:
Chief Growth & Marketing Officer at Supreme Lending
Driven by purpose. Grounded in people. Focused on impact.

With over three decades in the mortgage industry, Sarah Middleton has built a legacy on growth, innovation, and the quiet strength of people-first leadership.

As Chief Growth & Marketing Officer at Supreme Lending, she leads national expansion strategies, brand elevation, recruiting, and marketing innovation—supporting loan officers and branch managers through a platform built on excellence, integrity, and service.

Supreme’s 26-year foundation is rooted in humility, heart, and high performance—values that align deeply with Sarah’s lifelong mission to enrich lives, empower others, and build what lasts. Her work centers on removing barriers, simplifying processes, and equipping sales leaders with the tools, coaching, and culture they need to thrive.

Prior to joining Supreme, Sarah served as Chief Growth Officer at Movement Mortgage, where she helped lead company-wide initiatives in sales development, onboarding, coaching, product expansion, CRM adoption, and leadership engagement. She also launched the VA Advisory Board, the Product Advisory Board, and the Changemakers platform.

Her previous chapter included nearly a decade at Fairway Independent Mortgage, where she served as President of Sales Development and CEO of Fairway Ignite, an internal coaching platform that supported over 1,500 originators and leaders.

Earlier roles include regional leadership at Guild Mortgage and Liberty Financial Group, where she led production growth from $0 to $2B annually. Her originator record—$2B and 11,700 units closed in Colorado—still stands today, powered by a loyal team she’s led for over 20 years.

But titles don’t tell the full story. Sarah’s true calling has always been transformation—from building high-trust teams to elevating people into the leaders they’re meant to be.

She lives in Columbine Valley, CO with her husband “Miracle Mark,” is affectionately called “Yay-Yay” by her grandbabies, and continues to live her faith out loud. She believes success starts at home—and that the best work begins by lifting others up.

Let’s go build something beautiful.
column159: Sarah recruited, mentored and developed a successful branch that became the top producing branch within Guild Mortgage. She loved coaching LO's, created long term relationships with her customers and helped them achieve home ownership with no headaches. She set a high level of excellence that was continuously met.
column171: Sarah started up a division in Colorado for Liberty, taking it from $0 to 15 million in closed loan volume per month in 16 months.

Life at home has been at the heart of our business for 112 years - it is why we exist and why we are passionate about what we do. Beginning with our founders to the everyday actions of our people, our values have always kept us grounded -- Integrity, Respect, Inclusion & Diversity, One Whirlpool, Spirit of Winning. What we do at Whirlpool Corporation matters because consumers trust our brands. We never take that for granted and we work every day to earn that trust as we are committed to being the best kitchen and laundry company, in constant pursuit of improving life at home.

ABOUT WHIRLPOOL CORPORATION 
Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE: WHR) is a leading kitchen and laundry appliance company, in constant pursuit of improving life at home and inspiring generations with our brands. The company is driving meaningful innovation to meet the evolving needs of consumers through its iconic brand portfolio, including Whirlpool, KitchenAid, JennAir, Maytag, Amana, Brastemp, Consul, and InSinkErator. In 2023, the company reported approximately $19 billion in annual sales, 59,000 employees, and 55 manufacturing and technology research centers.  Additional information about the company can be found at WhirlpoolCorp.com.

column118: Driving manufacturing excellence
column119:
Ascent Aerospace combines assembly line integration and factory automation with our heritage tooling businesses, to provide turnkey production solutions from one, vertically-integrated organization. We employ more than 800 industry professionals across 11 locations, with five factories and two dedicated engineering centers of excellence.

But, at Ascent, we are much more than the sum of our parts. We pull together the unparalleled skills and knowledge of the best-respected experts in their fields, to provide complete solutions, without ever compromising on excellence. We offer the best of both worlds: the know-how of niche businesses and the scale and capacity of a global company.

Together our businesses, each an industry leader in its own right, cover the full spectrum of automation technology. Whatever the need or application, we provide affordable, right-sized solutions. 

As a vertically integrated organization, we rarely have to set foot outside Ascent to procure key elements of the supply chain. It gives us greater control over timing and schedules, allows for 100% accountability, and avoids costly mark-ups. It’s no surprise, then, that our customers include the biggest and best names in aerospace. Virtually every western commercial aircraft in production today is made using our technology, machines and systems.
column122: Transparencies for military jet canopies and windshields
column151:
I am a problem solver, from coordinating with customers to crack complex challenges to creating internal teams to develop and implement new business processes that enhance business functionality and profitability.

I spent the first portion of my career in various manufacturing engineering roles, architecting production systems for customers around the globe. From the United States F-35 to the Russian Helicopters (for NATO) Mi-17 to COMAC's C919 and everything in between. This global diversity allowed me to develop an exhaustive list of best practices that not only optimized production systems but also business processes that ultimately drove the organization's success. These journeys with customers have fueled exponential growth, such as KUKA Systems, whose Aerospace group grew from $3 million to $220 million, or Ascent Aerospace’s journey into secret-level work or breaking into the Japanese market.
In the recent phase of my career, I have redirected my problem-solving focus towards engineer-to-order (ETO) companies. In these businesses, I have found that the key to advancement lies in fostering an engaged and accountable team that crafts customer success stories. As a specialist in the ETO environment, I have a deep understanding of the unique conditions within these businesses. This includes strategies to position companies in the market for additional revenue streams and detailed job costing methodologies that ensure profitability throughout the job lifecycle. This expertise has equipped me with a refined skillset to serve these organizations effectively. In my most recent journey at Sharp Tooling Solutions, these honed skillsets became evident with the vast growth of customer diversity and implementation of job cost techniques, allowing the overall budget to actual variance to remain positive while in a challenging market.  All the while, a profitable product line dissolved, and the company’s access to automotive opportunities stagnated.

I am best positioned for success when aligned with a strong financial partner to manage the company's finances, cash flow, and bank relationships. This allows me to focus on the company's customers, culture, and operations.

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
